Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani daringly sped around third on a sharp grounder just inside the third-base line, except the ball bounced off of Ripperger and eventually was picked up by Manny Machado, who threw Ohtani out at home.
Will Smith blasted another weak pitch over the center-field fence, one dugout dancing, the other one sulking — game over.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers entered missing two key injured players — Freddie Freeman and Miguel Rojas — and were forced to navigate with no starter and all bullpen.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'When you get into the postseason, it’s a street fight.'
Teoscar Hernández said, 'One of the things we think about is he’s not 100% on rest, we’re going to make him work.'
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers reliever Blake Treinen’s teammates visited him on the mound during an 8-0 win over the Padres at Petco Park Wednesday.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'It’s about people, players, and your desire has got to be more than your opponent.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres haven’t scored in 15 innings dating to the second inning of Game 3.
The Dodgers have one more chance, one more moment, one more game.
